channel.title: New Objective & Rewards interface
channel.description:
I've been trying to get the ItemOnInterface, or sendFrame34 done, but i can't fudgeing get it to work. Its really frustrating me, so if anyone knows, let me know.
Anyways... Opinions?
[img]http://i.gyazo.com/38f2723aeef345313af3ad72e1a81d9d.gif[/img] [img]http://i.gyazo.com/04ede91dbf1200aff0eb698325cb05d2.gif[/img] [img]http://i.gyazo.com/f289ade30669fcb1a3ac934249d7b6f8.gif[/img] [img]http://i.gyazo.com/c9fb80760eea4447fe94c52ab5e0bb5f.png[/img]

item.title: New Objective & Rewards interface
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

It’s fine but that’s just so much space for each and every achievement that you make, I imagine there being a much more efficient route to take than this one but that’s in my opinion nonetheless. Either or, keep up the nice work and wish for the best.

Read full topic

item.title: New Objective & Rewards interface
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

As I said on skype, the interface is too empty… Even if/when/after you’d add the items on interface.
I suggested a list on the side of the interface to take over his current achievement list, instead of splitting the quest tab.

And I don’t like how you’re saving the achievements… It looks like you’re just using a bunch of Integers in your Player class. And that also means you’re probably using some if statements to check if each variable is equal to/less than specific values…

Granted my player saving is done in JSON, this is how it looks for a player’s achievements:

"achievements":[
{"partsCompleted":1,"achievementName":"DEATH","completed":true}
]

And my AchievementManager class handles the rest of it… Like how many parts it takes for the achievement to complete and so on…

Read full topic
